alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 19 at 12:09PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NAVAJO COUNTY THROUGH 1245 PM MST... At 1208 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Castle Butte, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dilkon and Castle Butte. This includes State Route 87 between mile markers 365 and 374. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
